DataElement.preferredName: Patient Breast Reconstruction Transverse Upper Gracilis Flap Performed Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to record information related to breast reconstruction using TUG flap.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Breast Reconstruction Transverse Upper Gracilis Flap Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Surgery to rebuild the shape of the breast after a mastectomy._A horizontal surface or plane perpendicular to a vertical axis._Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two._The most superficial muscle extending vertically downward along the inner thigh which adducts the thigh, rotates the leg medially and flexes the knee._A unit of tissue that is transferred from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Mammoplasty Transverse Plane Upper Gracilis Flap Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Surgery to rebuild the shape of the breast after a mastectomy.:A horizontal surface or plane perpendicular to a vertical axis.:Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.:The most superficial muscle extending vertically downward along the inner thigh which adducts the thigh, rotates the leg medially and flexes the knee.:A unit of tissue that is transferred from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A horizontal surface or plane perpendicular to a vertical axis.
Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
The most superficial muscle extending vertically downward along the inner thigh which adducts the thigh, rotates the leg medially and flexes the knee.
A unit of tissue that is transferred from one site to another while maintaining its own blood supply.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
